intro: Snapping gum makes a sound similar to popping a bubble, but keeps the gum inside your mouth. There are a couple of different ways to make this noise. Once you've found one that works well for you, you can practice snapping the gum repeatedly while you chew.

steps.title: Suck in the air.
steps.subtitle: Part your lips slightly, so there's a gap between them. Suck a short burst of air in quickly, and some of the gum should snap back into your mouth, making a noise.
sub-points: You might need to practice for a while before you can get this. Even once you learn it, it might not happen every time.
